Fechas de empleo
dic 2019 – ene 2021
Duración del empleo
1 año y 2 meses
Ubicación
Tel Aviv, Israel
WeissBeerger is a Start-Up company in the Big Data and IOT world, with the leading data analytics platform in the Food & Beverage Industry. The company was acquired by Anheuser-Busch Inbev and is now serving as an important analytics arm within the largest brewer in the world.
- Built a clustering model that optimized the customer spend of 162k ABInBev B2B customers in the Dominican Republic.
- Designed and developed an ML recommendation engine for bar and restaurant owners to accelerate their revenue by recommending products and combos that would lead to the highest profit for each business personally.
- Led machine learning projects for supervised and unsupervised classification and regression problems.
- Mentored analysts with theoretical and practical materials from basics to state-of-the-art Data Science methodologies.
- Worked with BigData environments including Spark, Hive, and AWS.
- Presented Data Science related materials in C-level meetings and for business units.

Graduated magna cum laude.
Fast track program for excelling students for M.Sc. in data science (direct track from BSc to MSc).

The master thesis dealt with developing an innovative measure for quantifying the effects of post-stroke spasticity on motor performance, using Python, R, and MATLAB. The developed method is used for monitoring the rehabilitation process in patients after stroke.
Presented the research at “Progress in Motor Control”, Netherlands, 2019, at “Karniel Computational Motor Control Workshop”, Israel, 2019, and at a Microsoft data science club talk, Israel, 2019.

jun 2019 – actualidad
Duración del empleo

Ubicación
Tel Aviv, Israel
Riskified is the AI platform powering the eCommerce revolution. We use cutting-edge technology, ML algorithms, and behavioral analytics to identify legitimate customers and keep them moving toward checkout. Merchants use Riskified to increase revenue, prevent fraud, and eliminate customer friction.

The Research and Data Science department is focused on bringing value to Riskified through the development of algorithms and analytical solutions. The department uses a wide variety of advanced techniques and algorithms to provide maximum value from data in all shapes and sizes.

In my role I’ve trained, validated and compared ML classification models for fraud detection - including sampling, feature engineering, and the research of how to optimize the performance of these models. My current focus is the design, development and research of offline tools - that uses anomaly detection, graph theory and more - for the detection of large, sophisticated fraud attacks.

- Implemented the following modelling strategies: Word2Vec, FastText, WordNet, BabelNet and BERT.
- With focus on BERT fed with a full sentence for set expansion as introduced in the paper ‘A two-Staged Masked LM Method for Term Expansion [G. Kushilevitz, S. Markovitch, Y. Goldberg, May 2020]. Together with filtering only positive sentences, with at least 10 words, in an effort to assure enough context.
- Improved and evaluated using mAP score.

The thesis focused on designing and developing a system for automatic generation of end-to-end machine learning pipelines using state-of-the-art deep reinforcement learning algorithms. The research included the creation of a new simulated AutoML RL environment and a novel method to mediate the agent-environment interaction. As part of the system a wide range of deep learning and machine learning models were used, including LSTMs, Embedding models, and many classification models for tabular data such as gradient boosting and random forest.

edu:
Educación
Weizmann Institute of Science
Nombre de la titulación
Master of Science - MS
Disciplina académica
Physics
Nota
91
Fechas de estudios o fecha de graduación prevista
2015 – 2017
My first semester at Weizmann was devoted to advanced courses in quantum mechanics and statistical physics. I then joined Moty Heiblum's lab, aimed to prove one of the most exciting phenomenon in condensed matter physics - Majorana quasiparticles.
My work in the lab included fabrication and electrical measurements of devices composed of one dimensional semiconductors and one dimensional superconductors. The devices were of micometers long, measured in extremely low temperatures using cutting edge technology.
During my time at the lab, we have succeeded in measuring new types of evidence for the existence of the Majorana quasiparticles. These quasiparticles might just be the building blocks of the future quantum computer.
The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Nombre de la titulación
Bachelor's degree
Disciplina académica
Physics
Nota
90
Fechas de estudios o fecha de graduación prevista
2011 – 2015
Laying the foundations for my future studies, I studied a variety of subjects in Physics, Mathematics (calculus, statistics, linear algebra) and Programming (Matlab and C++).
Physics courses included mechanics, electricity, waves and optics, quantum physics, statistical physics, solid state, oceanography etc. I also gained practical lab experience during all three years of my studies.
The Hebrew University of Jerusalem
Nombre de la titulación
Bachelor's degree
Disciplina académica
Cognitive Science
Nota
90
Fechas de estudios o fecha de graduación prevista
2011 – 2015
The cognitive science program includes fundamental studies in each of the main areas constituting cognitive science: Psychology, linguistics, philosophy and logic, computation and cognition, neuroanatomy and brain and cognition.
As part of the program, I wrote a seminar work in the guidence of Prof. Israel Nelken. The goal of my seminar work was to investigate which of two theoretical models best describes a certain phenomenon occuring in the auditory part of the brain. The work included writing the simulations for the theoretical modelts in Matlab and investigating the parameter space in order to find the best correlations with experimental results.

2020 Data Science Program; Israel Tech Challenge (Excellence Scholarship) – A five-months full-time training course in collaboration with tech companies for STEM BSc/MSc graduates.

Among the taught material: Data Exploration, Data Preprocessing, Feature Engineering and Feature Extraction, Dimensionality Reduction, Machine Learning Modeling (Supervised and Unsupervised, including Deep Learning and Neural Networks), Model Evaluation, Model Optimization, Data Visualization, Web Scraping, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing. During my work experience as a researcher while pursuing my MSc degree in Computer Science, I had an extensive range of responsibilities including selecting features, optimizing classifiers, mining data, improving data collection techniques, and processing data. As a Data Scientist, I was required to have excellent understanding of algorithms, excellence in the Python, Pandas, Sickit-learn. I also hold knowledge of SQL, and excellence in applied statistics. During my 3 years working as a researcher, I applied these skills daily. During this time, I developed T-SED – A Text-based Social Engineering Detector of polymorphic malwares. T-SED perform excellent in real time mode, holding precision of 99% and AUC of 93%.

Fellows Program
Disciplina académica
Data Science
Fechas de estudios o fecha de graduación prevista
2017 – 2018
ITC Fellows is an elite 10-month training program in Data Science, aimed for
excellent STEM graduates from top universities around the globe who aspires
to launch a career in the tech world.

The program includes 5 months of intensive training inspired by the IDF’s 8200
training methods and a 5-month paid internship in top tech companies.
The program’s curriculum focuses on: Machine Learning, Deep Learning,
Computer Vision, Big Data, Modeling and more.

Fellows graduates work as Data scientists in leading international and local
Israeli companies, including Google, Facebook, Apple, PayPal, CheckPoint and
Intel.

Israel Tech Challenge (ITC) offers talented professionals from around the
world both training and job placement assistance in leading Israeli tech
companies. The organization’s programs offer the most in-demand skills in
tech along with strong networking in the Israeli eco system.

Data Scientist
Nombre de la empresa
Via Jornada completa
Fechas de empleo
oct 2019 – jul 2020
Duración del empleo
10 meses
Ubicación
Tel-Aviv, Israël
▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
Rider Reports Classification:
- Business Problem refinement: refining the label categorization according to business problematics.
Categorizing across: vehicle issues, pickup-dropoff issues, driver complaints, safety issues.
- Data Acquisition: Acquiring data from SQL database, and integrating into Pandas DataFrame.
- Preprocessing: joining between multiple tables, data cleaning: missing values, incorrect labels.
- Data Exploration: exploring whether dataset is balanced / unbalanced, correlation between labels, matplotlib, seaborn.
- Data Labellization of training data: Jupyter Notebook, ipyWidget, labellization by students of about 3k rows.
- Model Training: splitting data across train/test subsets. Researching most relevant model towards training. Choosing SotA Transformers DistilBERT NLP model to extract word embeddings of each words and sentence in the Training data.
Loss function: sum of logits across category probabilities.
Saving to a PyTorch model with Pickle.
- Model evaluation: accuracy metric.
Analyzing confusion matrix to pinpoint model issues, and iterate again with newly labelled more specialized data.
- Deployment: creating a new column in the SQL database with the more precise category detected by our model.
Working together with Devops Engineer in the team to load dynamically the categorization of issues in a live map based on Google Maps API

▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬▬
Building a live map centralizing operations issues, such as off-route, pickup/dropoff delays, client complaints.
Normalizing delays, and attributing score to road portions to indicate a "delay indicator".
Correlating those with rider complaints to identify most problematic portions.
Defining custom metrics such as off-route count, sum of delays, delay cost

Serving with REST API based on AWS Lamba.
- Inputs: city, which metrics, count_limit
- Business logic: querying SQL database securely
- Output: JSON with categories, metrics etc.

Data Scientist Intern - Fight Against Terrorist Financing (FATF)

During my internship at BPCE, I worked in the Big Data team of the DRCPC (Department of Risk, Compliance and Permanent Control).
I first studied about Graph Theory and Community Detection and then wrote a state of the art for Community Detection.
Then I build a global model of detection of terrorist financing based on Louvain's Algorithm.
The results where integrated to the general project of FATF through a web application I helped to develop in Shiny (interactive graph visualization, dynamic calculation, ...).

Through this I used skills in scientific research and writing, coding in R for modeling, igraph package, SQL data handling, and Shiny data visualization.

During this semester abroad, I was studying Machine Learning, Algorithmics, Probabilities, Finance and Stochastic Processes at the Technion Institute of Technology, a science and technology research university, among the world’s top ten. The Technion is dedicated to the creation of knowledge and the development of human capital and leadership, for the advancement of the State of Israel and all humanity.

Fechas de estudios o fecha de graduación prevista
2015 – 2018
Co-supervised by Professor Yossi Yovel from Sagol School of Neuroscience and the Zoology department and Doctor Liad Mudrik from Sagol School of Neuroscience and the Cognitive Psychology Department.

Thesis title: "Crashing despite sensing".

The experiment was done in awake bats that had to fly in a corridor and avoid static objects.
I analyzed the data using my own scripts in Matlab.

My chosen courses were focused on computational neuroscience, machine learning and signal processing (EEG, sound, image and more).

During this time, I have also preformed two more EEG experiments; one on humans and one on South African bats as a part of a special delegation that was sent to South Africa.

bestdeal.shop
DataCamp
Distrito de Tel Aviv, Israel Información de contacto
exp:
Founder & CEO
Nombre de la empresa
bestdeal.shop
Fechas de empleo
mar 2019 – actualidad
Duración del empleo
2 años y 10 meses
Ubicación
Tel Aviv, Israel
Founded and lead a retail automation business and launched a 2-year concept flagship. While we discontinued work on bestdeal.shop, our mission was to become the first and successful leading provider of innovative RFID UHF-enabled retail (coupled with comprehensive neuromarketing and ML solutions to real-time shopping behaviour) for a seamless checkout process, invaluable retail insights, predictive retargeting and automated supply chain management. Despite gaining traction among consumers and investors, I have concluded this project as we were not able to land series funding to get bestdeal.shop into escape velocity. The online shopping platform is yet active.

We successfully deployed the initial design phase of our system, with POC prototype iteration comprised of active RFID readers, precisely calibrated to quickly identify products with outsourced custom printed passive tags.

My time with bestdeal.shop has given me invaluable experience in building innovative products and acquiring a leadership role pertaining to commanding presence and a clear vision. With continued humility, I am keen to find greater success in disruptive strategy and refined operational knowledge with limited resources. bestdeal.shop has taught me that data tells us more than just numbers, it helps us understand our users and their desires, and unpack an ensemble of latent errors in any business setting.

Nombre de la titulación
Fellows-Data Science
Fechas de estudios o fecha de graduación prevista
2017 – 2018
ITC Fellows is an elite 10-month training program in Data Science, aimed for excellent STEM graduates from top universities around the globe who aspires to launch a career in the tech.
The program includes 5 months of intensive training inspired by the IDF’s 8200 training methods and a 5-month paid internship in top tech companies.
The program’s curriculum focuses on: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Big Data, Modeling and more.
Fellows graduates work as Data scientists in leading international and local Israeli companies, including Google, Facebook, Apple, PayPal, CheckPoint and Intel.
Israel Tech Challenge offers talented professionals from around the world both training and job placement assistance in leading Israeli tech companies. The organization’s programs offer the most in-demand skills in tech along with strong networking in the Israeli eco system. To date, ITC introduced over 400 developers to the Israeli high-tech industry.

⭐️ Design and implement large scale statistical and machine learning models, deploy them into production and analyze their performance. Find solutions to business problems using scientific methods.

⭐️ Developing the algorithms behind the Creative AI: ✯ Building an algorithm that select from each creative, 3 main colors that prominent to the human eye. ✯ Applying statistical models and machine learning algorithms in R & Python, to explore the relationship between creative elements & color schemes and creative success.

About the Creative AI (CAI):
The CAI aim to help advertisers develop ad creatives that truly perform. It eliminates the guesswork involved in developing ad creative. The CAI helps client to learn which elements drive performance & gives specific recommendations for winning creatives. In addition, it reveals color combinations that work best to help achieve campaign objectives.
For more details visit: https://bidalgo.com/creative-ai/

About Bidalgo:
Bidalgo is the leading provider of AI-driven ad automation software and services for app marketers. As an official marketing partner of Facebook, Google, Snapchat, Pinterest and other channels, Bidalgo manages more than $500 million in annual ad spend for mobile app clients.

⭐️ Design and implement large scale statistical and machine learning models, deploy them into production and analyze their performance. Find solutions to business problems using scientific methods.

⭐️ Developing the algorithms behind the Creative AI: ✯ Building an algorithm that select from each creative, 3 main colors that prominent to the human eye. ✯ Applying statistical models and machine learning algorithms in R & Python, to explore the relationship between creative elements & color schemes and creative success.

About the Creative AI (CAI):
The CAI aim to help advertisers develop ad creatives that truly perform. It eliminates the guesswork involved in developing ad creative. The CAI helps client to learn which elements drive performance & gives specific recommendations for winning creatives. In addition, it reveals color combinations that work best to help achieve campaign objectives.
For more details visit: https://bidalgo.com/creative-ai/

About Bidalgo:
Bidalgo is the leading provider of AI-driven ad automation software and services for app marketers. As an official marketing partner of Facebook, Google, Snapchat, Pinterest and other channels, Bidalgo manages more than $500 million in annual ad spend for mobile app clients.

• Organized and led the manual testing of the Glassesoff product - a revolutionary smartphone application that can eliminate the need for reading glasses.

• Supported hundreds of international customers and beta-users by E-mail, phone, and personal interactions.

• Worked under a tough deadline schedule in a small startup company, including the initial release of the product and through regular updates and bug fixes.

• Reported directly to CEO and VP R&D.

• Wrote and reviewed bug reports and testing plans. Before version updates, I coordinated and monitored the testing of the product that was done by all company employees simultaneously, and tracked the most important issues that needed further action.

• Led the implementation and customization of JIRA for all the company.

• Worked together with all relevant teams - management, product, developers, marketing. Reported findings to technical and nontechnical colleagues.

• Identified bugs at an early stage and suggested new features and product improvements, that were suited to meet the needs of the product users. Queried application users in person and by phone to better understand their in-app behavior.

Actividades y asociaciones: • Human computer interaction (HCI) Conference Presentor
• Built a machine learning model for automatic detection of movement compensations in stroke
patients.

Standard clinical rating conducted by human observation is the prevailing way today to monitor
motor recovery of the patient. Therefore, a patient cannot know whether he or she is performing a
movement properly while exercising by herself. This is the first study to automatically identify
movement compensations based on stroke patients' data.

Our article was published in "IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computing".

Zesty allows engineering teams to effortlessly maximize cloud savings and minimize waste by automating cloud cost optimization. The Zesty AI-driven platform automatically adjusts cloud resources in real-time based on the application needs, achieving optimal cloud usage, and a dramatic reduction in cloud spend.

Zesty is growing, and we are looking for amazing engineers to join our team. If you are interested in large scale distributed systems and want to influence the cloud's future, your place is with us! We have many hard engineering challenges coming up, and we're looking for innovative, daring minds to join the team.
